name: Barbarian
shortDesc: A fierce warrior of primitive background who can enter a battle rage
longDesc: Barbarians are defined by their rage. Their rage is a power that fuels a battle frenzy, as well as uncanny reflexes, resilience, and feats of strength. A barbarian can enter a beserker state where rage takes over, giving them superhuman strength and resilience./n/n/To a barbarian, civilization is a sign of weakness. They are uncomfortable when hedged in by walls and crowds and thrive in the wilds of their homeland. The barbarian is a protector of the people and leader in times of war. Courage in the face of danger is what makes a barbarian perfectly suited for adventuring.

startEquip.weapon2: two handaxes OR any simple weapon

types.name: Path of the Beserker
types.desc: This is the path of untrammeled fury, slick with blood. As you enter the beserker’s rage, you thrill in the chaos of battle, heedless of your own health or well-being.

types.name: Path of the Totem Warrior
types.desc: This path is a spiritual journey, as the barbarian accepts a spirit animal as guide, protector, and inspiration. In battle, your totem spirit fills you with supernatural might, adding magical fuel to your barbarian rage. It is unusual for an individual to have more than one totem spirit, but exceptions do exist.

name: Bard
shortDesc: An inspiring magician whose power echoes the music of creation.
longDesc:
The bard is a master of song, speech, and the magic they contain. The music of bards is an attempt to snatch and harness the echos of the Words of Creation used to shape the multiverse.

The greatest strength of bards is their sheer versatility. They have a wide-ranging knowledge of many subjects and a natural aptitude that lets them do almost anything well. True bards are not common, but it can be hard to spot the difference between an everyday performer and a bard. Discovering the magic hidden in music requires hard study and a measure of natural talent.

 Bards rarely settle in one place for long, and their natural desire to travel makes an adventuring career a natural calling.

startEquip.weapon1: rapier OR longsword OR any simple weapon

types.name: College of Lore
types.desc:
Bards of this college know something about most things, collecting bits of knowledge from sources as diverse as scholarly tomes and peasant tales. They use their gifts to hold audiences spellbound.

The loyalty of these bards lies in the pursuit of beauty and truth. Member's of this college gather in libraries and actual colleges. They also meet at festivals or affairs of state, where they can expose corruption, unravel lies, and poke fun at self-important authority figures.

types.name: College of Valor
types.desc:
Bards of this college are daring poets whose tales keep alive the memory of great heros past. They trave the land to witness great events firsthand and to ensure that the memory of those events doesn’t pass from the world.

These bards gather in mead halls or around great bonfires to sing the deeds of the mighty, both past and present.

name: Cleric
shortDesc: A priestly champion who wields divine magic in service of a higher power.
longDesc:
Clerics are intermediaries between the mortal world and the distant planes of the gods. They strive to embody the handiwork of their deities and are imbued with divine magic. The ability to cast cleric spells relies on devotion and an intuitive sense of a deity's wishes.

 When a cleric takes up an adventuring life, it is usually because his/her god demands it. Pursuing the goals of the gods often involves braving dangers beyond the walls of civilization. Many clerics are also expected to proctect their deity's worshipers.

startEquip.weapon2: light crossbow with 20 bolts OR any simple weapon
misc: scale mail OR leather armor OR chain mail (if proficient)

types.name: Knowledge Domain
types.desc: The gods of knowledge value learning and understanding above all. Some gods teach that knowledge is to be gathered and shared, while others hoard knowledge and keep their secrets to themselves. Followers of these gods study esoteric lore, collect old tomes, delve into secret places of the earth, and learn all they can.

features.name: Additional Spells: Nondetection and Speak with Dead
Additional Spells: Arcane Eye and Confusion
Additional Spells: Legend Lore and Scrying

types.name: Life Domain
types.desc: This domain focuses on the vibrant positive energy that sustains all life. The gods of life promote vitality and health through healing the sick and wounded, caring for those in need, and driving away the forces of death and undeath. Almost any non-evil diety can claim influence over this domain.

features.name: Additional Spells: Bless and Cure Wounds
Additional Spells: Lesser Restoration and Spiritual Weapon
Additional Spells: Beacon of Hope and Revivfy
Additional Spells: Death Ward and Guardian of Faith
Additional Spells: Mass Cure Wounds and Raise Dead

types.name: Light Domain
types.desc: Gods of light promote the ideals of rebirth and renewal, truth, vigilance, and beauty, often using the symbol of the sun. Clerics of a god of light are enlightened souls infused with radiance and the power of their god's discerning vision, charged with chasing away lies and burning away darkness.

features.name: Additional Spells: Burning Hands and Faerie Fire
Additional Spells: Flaming Sphere and Scorching Ray
Additional Spells: Guardian of Faith and Wall of Fire
Additional Spells: Flame Strike and Scrying

types.name: Nature Domain
types.desc: Gods of nature are as varied as the natural world itself. Druids revere nature as a whole and might serve one of these deities, but many of these gods have clerics as well, champions who take a more active role in advancing the interests of a particular nature god.

features.name: Additional Spells: Animal Friendship and Speak with Animals
Additional Spells: Barkskin and Spike Growth
Additional Spells: Plant Growth and Wind Wall
Additional Spells: Dominate Beast and Grasping Vine
Additional Spells: Insect Plague and Tree Stride

types.name: Tempest Domain
types.desc: Gods who influence the tempest domain govern storms, sea, and sky. They include gods of lightening and thunder, gods of earthquakes, some fire gods, and certain gods of violence, physical strength, and courage. Tempest gods send their clerics to inspire fear in the common folk, either to keep those folk on the path of righteousness or to encourage them offer sacrifices of propiation to ward off divine wrath.

features.name: Additional Spells: Fog Cloud and Thunderwave
Additional Spells: Gust of Wind and Shatter
Additional Spells: Call Lightening and Sleet Storm
Additional Spells: Control Water and Ice Storm
Additional Spells: Destructive Wave and Insect Plague

types.name: Trickery Domain
types.desc: Gods of trickery are mischief-makers and instigators who stand as a constant challenge to the accepted order among gods and mortals. They’re patrons of thieves, scoundrels, gamblers, rebels, and liberators. Their clerics are a disruptive force in the world who prefer subterfuge, pranks, deception, and theft rather than direct confrontation.

features.name: Additional Spells: Charm Person and Disguise Self
Additional Spells: Mirror Image and Pass without Trace
Additional Spells: Blink and Dispel Magic
Additional Spells: Dimension Door and Polymorph
Additional Spells: Dominate Person and Modify Memory

types.name: War Domain
types.desc: The gods of war watch over warriors and reward them for their great deeds. Their clerics excel in battle, inspiring others to fight or offering acts of violence as prayers. Gods of war include champions of honor and chivalry as well as gods of conquest and domination. Other gods of war take a more neutral stance, promoting war in all its manifestations and supporting warriors in any circumstance.

features.name: Additional Spells: Divine Favor and Shield of Faith
Additional Spells: Magic Weapon and Spiritual Weapon
Additional Spells: Crusader’s Mantle and Spirit Guardians
Additional Spells: Freedom of Movement and Stoneskin
Additional Spells: Flame Strike and Hold Monster

name: Druid
shortDesc: A priest of the Old Faith, weilding the powers of nature- moonlight and plant growth, fire and lightening -and adopting animal forms.
longDesc:
Druids are an embodiment of nature’s resilience, cunning, and fury. They claim no mastery over nature, but see themselves as extensions of nature’s indomitable will. Druids revere nature above all, gaining their spells and other magical powers either from the force of nature itself or from a nature deity. The ancient druidic traditions are sometimes called the Old Faith, in contrast to the worship of gods in temples and shrines.

 For druids, nature exists in a precarious balance. The four elements that make up a world (air, earth, fire, and water) must remain in equilibrium. Druids are also concerned with the delicate ecological balance that sustains plant and animal life, and the need for civilized folk to live in harmony with nature. Druids accept that which is cruel in nature and hate the unnatural. Druids are often found guarding sacred sites or watching over regions of unspoiled nature.

startEquip.weapon1: wooden shield OR any simple weapon
startEquip.weapon2: scimitar OR any simple melee weapon

armorProf: *Druids will not wear armor or use shieldsw made of metal*

types.name: Circle of the Land
types.desc: This circle is made up of mystics and sages who safeguard ancient knowledge and rites through a vast oral tradition. These druids meet within sacred circles of trees or standing stones to whisper primal secrets in Druidic. As a member of this circle, your magic is influenced by the land where you were initiated into the circle's mysterious rites. The different land types are: arctic, coast, desert, forest, grassland, mountain, swamp, and underdark.

types.name: Circle of the Moon
types.desc: This circle is made up of fierce guardians of the wilds. Their order gathers under the full moon to share news and trade warnings. They haunt the deepest parts of the wilderness, where they might go for weeks on end before crossing paths with another humanoid creature, let alone another druid. Changeable as the moon, the wild is in the druid’s blood.

name: Fighter
shortDesc: A master of martial combat, skilled with a variety of weapons and armor.
longDesc: Fighters all share an unparalleled mastery with weapons and armor, and a thorough knowledge of the skills of combat. Beyond the basic degree of familiarity, each fighter specializes in a certain style of combat. The combination of broad general ability and extensive specialization makes fighters superior combatants on battlefields and in dungeons alike.

startEquip.weapon2: light crossbow with 20 bolts OR any simple weapon
misc: scale mail OR leather armor OR chain mail (if proficient)

types.name: Knowledge Domain
types.desc: The gods of knowledge value learning and understanding above all. Some gods teach that knowledge is to be gathered and shared, while others hoard knowledge and keep their secrets to themselves. Followers of these gods study esoteric lore, collect old tomes, delve into secret places of the earth, and learn all they can.

features.name: Additional Spells: Nondetection and Speak with Dead
Additional Spells: Arcane Eye and Confusion
Additional Spells: Legend Lore and Scrying

misc: scale mail OR leather armor OR chain mail (if proficient)
